objinfo.medium: relief etching, color printed, with hand tinting and pen and ink drawing
objinfo.inkcolor: color printedThere is no clear evidence that any ink was used.
objinfo.pennednumbers: 9The number appears upper right above the printed image.

provenance.name: National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C.
provenance.note: Possibly one of the works acquired from Blake in Aug. 1797 by James Curry or at an unknown time by George Romney; possibly acquired by Isaac D'Israeli, who died in 1848; his son, Benjamin D'Israeli, later Earl of Beaconsfield; sold Hodgson auction, London, 14 Jan. 1904, lot 223 (£42 to the dealer Bernard Quaritch acting for F. P. Osmaston); Mrs. L. M. Osmaston, probably by inheritance; sold from her collection, Sotheby's, 14 Nov. 1928, lot 692 (£170 to the dealer Gabriel Wells, probably acting for Mr. and Mrs. Anton G. Hardy); sold from the Hardy collection, Parke-Bernet, 14 Jan. 1942, lot 20 ($575 to the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach acting for Lessing J. Rosenwald); given by Rosenwald to the National Gallery of Art, Washington, D. C., in 1943.

repository.addressline: Constitution Avenue NW, between 3rd and 9th Streets
Mailing Address: 2000B South Club Drive, Landover, Maryland 20785

desc.objtitle:
A Dream of Thiralatha,
Object 1 verso (Essick IX, Bentley 85.8, Butlin 267)

objnote.p: The transcription for this object is derived from the blind embossed text seen in reverse on this verso.

lg.l: As when a dream of Thiralatha flies the midnight hour:
In vain the dreamer grasps the joyful images, they fly
Seen in obscured traces in the Vale of Leutha, So
The British Colonies beneath the wofulwoeful Princes fade.
And so the Princes fade from earth, scarce seen by souls of men:
But tho'though obscurdobscured, this is the form of the Angelic land.

desc.objtitle:
A Dream of Thiralatha,
Object 1 verso reversed, high contrast (Essick IX, Bentley 85.8, Butlin 267)

objnote.p: The orientation of this image of the verso has been reversed and the contrast has been increased to allow for easier reading of the blind embossed text.

lg.l: As when a dream of Thiralatha flies the midnight hour:
In vain the dreamer grasps the joyful images, they fly
Seen in obscured traces in the Vale of Leutha, So
The British Colonies beneath the wofulwoeful Princes fade.
And so the Princes fade from earth, scarce seen by souls of men:
But tho'though obscurdobscured, this is the form of the Angelic land.
